intro: Alpinia fraseriana, commonly known as the Fraser's ginger, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and turmeric. The plant features tall, narrow leaves and produces fragrant, pale yellow to orange flowers in clusters. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Alpinia fraseriana thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires partial shade to full sun.
